Description: Hematite cylinder seal; contest scene; the design consists of two groups of contestants; a lion attacking a goat which looks back over its shoulder at its assailant; a lion attacking a bull from one side and a lion-griffin attacking it from the other. In the field are two drill holes. Terminal, a faintly inscribed crescent moon over two equally faint cuneiform signs. Line border round the bottom of the seal.
Bibliographic references: Collon 1986a / Catalogue of the Western Asiatic Seals in the British Museum: Cylinder Seals III: Isin-Larsa and Old Babylonian Periods (134)
Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.300)
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
